v.v: Six sons of King David were born in the city of Hebron.
His next son was Absalom, whose mother was Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, the king who ruled in the city of Geshur.
The next son was Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital.

v: His oldest son was Amnon, whose mother Ahinoam was from the city of Jezreel.
His next son was Daniel, whose mother was Abigail from the city of Carmel.
His next son was Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith.
His youngest son was Ithream, whose mother was Eglah.

v.v: They were all born in Hebron, where David ruled for seven and one-half years.
Many of David’s children were born in Jerusalem.
Nine other sons of David were also born there. They were Ibhar, Elishua, Elphelet,
Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
In addition to all those sons, David’s slave wives also gave birth to sons. David also had a daughter named Tamar.
Solomon’s son was King Rehoboam.
Jehoshaphat’s son was King Jehoram.
Joash’s son was King Amaziah.
Jotham’s son was King Ahaz.
Manasseh’s son was King Amon.
Josiah’s oldest son was Johanan. His other sons were Jehoiakim, Zedekiah, and Shallum.
Jehoiakim’s son was Jehoiachin. The last king was Zedekiah.
Jehoiachin was captured and taken to Babylon. His sons were Shealtiel,
Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
Pedaiah’s sons were Zerubbabel and Shimei.
Zerubbabel’s five other sons were Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-Hesed.
The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah. Jeshaiah’s son was Rephaiah. After him, other descendants of Hananiah were Arnan, Obadiah, and Shecaniah.
Shecaniah’s son was Shemaiah. Shemaiah’s five sons were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat.
Neariah’s three sons were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam.
Elioenai’s seven sons were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani.

v: Bathshua, daughter of Ammiel, gave birth to four of his sons: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon.
Two of Zerubbabel’s sons were Meshullam and Hananiah, and their sister was Shelomith.
